required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Corneal Endothelial Cell Changes After Phacoemulsification in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: 白内障超声乳化术对2型糖尿病患者角膜内皮细胞的影响 Corneal Endothelial Cell Changes After Phacoemulsification in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigate the change of the corneal endothelial cells in patients with type 2 diabetes after phacoemulsification with intraocular lens implantation.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators do the clinical prospective study including 30 patients with type 2 diabetes and 30 control patients without diabetes scheduled to undergo cataract surgery. The corneal endothelial cell density, variation in endothelial cell size (CV), percentage of hexagonal cells, and central corneal thickness(CCT) were recorded at baseline and at 3 months postoperatively.Then, the investigators compared the two sets of data. At last observing the change of the corneal endothelial cells in patients with type 2 diabetes after phacoemulsification with intraocular lens implantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the corneal endothelial cell density before-after cataract surgery
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of the corneal endothelial cell density before-after cataract surgery，the density is expressed in terms of the number of cells per square millimeter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the endothelial cell size before-after cataract surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the endothelial cell size before-after cataract surgery，the size is measured in square microns.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the percentage of hexagonal cells before-after cataract surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the percentage of hexagonal cells before-after cataract surgery,the percentage are expressed as "%".

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the central corneal thickness(CCT) before-after cataract surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the central corneal thickness(CCT) before-after cataract surgery，the thickness is in microns.

arm_group.description: patients with type 2 diabetes scheduled to undergo cataract surgery
patients without diabetes scheduled to undergo cataract surgery

intervention.description: The corneal endothelial cell density, variation in endothelial cell size (CV), percentage of hexagonal cells, and central corneal thickness(CCT) were recorded at baseline and at 3 months postoperatively.

study_pop.textblock: Among the 60 patients enrolled in this study, the experimental group was 77.5 ±9.2 years old, and the control age was 76.3±8.7 years, with no statistical difference (P = 0.87). All patients were treated for 3 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
the experimental group:
1. Clinical diagnosis of cataract
2. Type 2 diabetes mellitus
3. The recent blood glucose control was stable
4. The glycosylated hemoglobin < 8%
The control group:
1. Clinical diagnosis of cataract
2. No history of type 2 diabetes
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Corneal lesions
2. Anterior inflammation
3. Ocular trauma or surgical history
4. Glaucoma
5. Corneal endothelial cell density < 1500 / mm squared
